Description: Neck, reconstructed from sherds, of black figure painted pottery situla. B, Bull, in field incised rosettes: below, parts of lotus flowers and palmettes. Purple on ear, side-whiskers, shoulder stripe, hooves of bull, and on alternate petals of rosettes.
Curator's comments: This is one side of a situla neck (BMC B.106.5 (= B), the other side (under a different registration number - BMC B.106.1 (= A)) features the representation of two men fighting.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.5)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 601, 1-2; GB 598, 6) (Group C9)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxvi, 3a)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 249)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.121, pl.122, fig.13a-b, p.123)
